feed.title: Google Cloud: Memorystore for Valkey
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Memorystore for Valkey

entry.summary: A security fix has been implemented for CVE-2025-49844.
entry.title: Feature: Security Fix Deployed

entry.content: You can now use self-service maintenance to update your instance to a newer version. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.summary: You can now use self-service maintenance to update your Memorystore instances to newer versions. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: Self-service maintenance for Memorystore instances

entry.content: You can now create an instance in Memorystore for Valkey, even if a zone of the region where you want the instance to be created is unavailable. If this occurs, then Memorystore for Valkey creates the instance in the available zones of the region. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.summary: Memorystore for Valkey now supports creating instances in available zones within a region, even if the initially selected zone is unavailable. This ensures instance availability and is now Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: Memorystore for Valkey instances can now be created in available zones when a preferred zone is unavailable.

entry.content:
Memorystore for Valkey now supports maintenance changelogs. Maintenance changelogs provide information about updates available in new maintenance versions, such as patches for security vulnerabilities.

For links to current maintenance changelogs for each major version of Memorystore for Valkey, see Memorystore for Valkey maintenance changelogs. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.summary: You can now view maintenance changelogs for Memorystore for Valkey. This helps you stay informed about updates and security patches.
entry.title: Feature: Memorystore for Valkey maintenance changelogs

entry.content: For each primary node of a Memorystore for Valkey instance, you can now have up to five replica nodes. For more information, see Memorystore for Valkey overview. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.summary: You can now have up to five replica nodes for each primary node of a Memorystore for Valkey instance. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: Valkey instances now support more replicas
